attributes.image: Oswell Whent.png'''Oswell Whent''' is an unseen character in ''Game of Thrones''. He is not expected to appear in the series, being long dead by the time it starts. Ser Oswell Whent was a knight of House Whent a sworn brother of the Kingsguard of Aerys II Targaryen.==Biography=====Season 4===Ser Oswell is mentioned in the entry of his sworn brother, Lord Commander Gerold Hightower as recorded in ''The Book of Brothers''. The entry mentions the death of Ser Oswell along with Ser Gerold and Ser Arthur Dayne, fighting a small force led by Eddard Stark in the Red Mountains after refusing to bend the knee to the new king, Robert Baratheon.<ref>"Two Swords"</ref>==In the books==In the ''A Song of Ice and Fire'' novels, Ser Oswell Whent was a younger brother of Lord Whent, known and remembered for his dark humor. He wore a distinctive helmet emblazoned with a black bat with its wings spread, symbolizing House Whent. Oswell was present at the Tourney at Harrenhal where Jaime Lannister became a Kingsguard.==See also==*AWOIAF (spoilers from the books)==References==ReflistMadKingKingsguardDEFAULTSORT:Whent, OswellCategory:CharactersCategory:Mentioned CharactersCategory:Status: DeadCategory:KingsguardCategory:KnightsCategory:House Whent

'''Oswell Whent''' is an unseen character in ''[[Game of Thrones]]''. He is not expected to appear in the series, being long dead by the time it starts. Ser Oswell Whent was a [[knight]] of [[House Whent]] a sworn brother of the [[Kingsguard]] of [[Aerys II Targaryen]].
sections.In the books: In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, Ser Oswell Whent was a younger brother of Lord Whent, known and remembered for his dark humor. He wore a distinctive helmet emblazoned with a black bat with its wings spread, symbolizing House Whent. Oswell was present at the [[Tourney]] at Harrenhal where [[Jaime Lannister]] became a Kingsguard.
sections.Biography:
===[[Season 4]]===
Ser Oswell is mentioned in the entry of his sworn brother, Lord Commander [[Gerold Hightower]] as recorded in ''[[The Book of Brothers]]''. The entry mentions the death of Ser Oswell along with Ser Gerold and Ser [[Arthur Dayne]], fighting a small force led by [[Eddard Stark]] in the [[Red Mountains]] after refusing to bend the knee to the new king, [[Robert Baratheon]].<ref>"[[Two Swords]]"</ref>
